meanings.definition: To steal or take something without permission.
meanings.sent1: He jacked a cookie from the jar when no one was looking.
meanings.sent2: The thief jacked the purse from the unsuspecting victim.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon jacked the picnic basket during the family outing.
meanings.sent4: The sneaky cat jacked the toy mouse from the shelf.
meanings.sent5: The pirate jacked the treasure chest from the ship under the cover of night.

meanings.definition: To raise or lift something with effort.
meanings.sent1: She jacked up the car to change the flat tire.
meanings.sent2: The weightlifter jacked the heavy barbell above his head.
meanings.sent3: The students jacked the banner high during the school rally.
meanings.sent4: The workers jacked the heavy machinery onto the truck for transport.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter jacked the ladder to rescue the kitten from the tree.

meanings.definition: To be in a state of excitement or energy.
meanings.sent1: The kids were jacked up for the big game.
meanings.sent2: The crowd was jacked with enthusiasm at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was jacked with joy when its owner returned home.
meanings.sent4: The fans were jacked with anticipation for the movie premiere.
meanings.sent5: The team was jacked with determination to win the championship.
